status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9hj87","text":"By weight, create individual 20,000 µg/mL stock solutions of all monomers (listed in Materials section) and use methanol  as the diluent. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a0i0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al7jr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk1o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"afp5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b5bv8","text":"If compounds have not previously been analyzed on the column specified in this method, it is necessary to analyze each monomer separately (at a concentration of approximately 100 µg/mL) to determine retention time for each before analyzing a mixture containing all compounds. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pof9","text":"Combine the stock solutions to create a 1000 µg/mL mixed standard working solution in methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebabp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kshr","text":"Using the mixed standard working solution at 1000 µg/mL, create a calibration curve from 10 µg/mL to 1000 µg/mL with a minimum of five calibration points using methanol as the diluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25qf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

mL/min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6b3vc","text":"Makeup Flow: 10 mL/min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2ur5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tis3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ijqg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"747l2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bahm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bicdu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4BB51800D3C911EDA6388F675FA4003F","height":104.1666666666667,"id":360697,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mah5bs5kx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mah3bs5kx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mah4bs5kx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mah2bs5kx.webp","width":375.00000000000017}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"437st","text":"This analysis uses 1,3,5-tri-tert-butylbenzene (TTB) as an internal standard. Prepare adequate volume to allow for addition of 1µL of TTB per 100 µL of sample or standard volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rq2r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"207i6","text":"Create a 10,000 µg/mL internal standard working solution by weight of TTB using methanol as the diluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"323lp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce8rm","text":"For example, to prepare a 10 mL mixed standard working solution of woody RCF analytes (distinguished in Materials section), add 500 µL of each of the 20,000 µg/mL stock solutions (14 analytes) and add 3000 µL methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15up9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0c2c","text":"Several strategies are utilized when performing this analysis to ensure instrument stability and reproducibility. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18j03","text":"Calibration Curves","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"382l6","text":"All compounds must have a correlation coefficient (r2) of 0.995 or greater using a linear calibration fit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f38b5","text":"Calibration Verification Standards (CVS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hje","text":"A calibration verification standard (CVS) is a standard from the calibration curve that is re-analyzed every 20 or fewer samples to ensure instrument drift remains within the determined acceptance criteria. Acceptable CVS recoveries for this analysis are within 15% of the expected amount. Acceptance criteria may differ between instruments and should be determined experimentally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16qnb","text":"Add 1 µL of 10,000 µg/mL TTB internal standard working solution per every 100 µL of calibration standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ofdl","text":"Example:  10 µL into 1000 µL or 5 µL into 500 µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cra","text":"Oil Samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cj9vs","text":"Weigh approximately 5-10 mg of oil into a GC vial and record weight.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eokeq","text":"Add a known volume of methanol to each vial containing sample (for example 1 mL).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kt94","text":"Add 1 µL of 10,000 µg/mL TTB for every 100 µL of methanol added to the sample vial.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cldo","text":"    Example: 10 µL into 1000 µL or 5 µL into 500 µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2v1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auq5l","text":"Liquid Samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1qq9","text":"Aliquot a known volume of sample into a GC vial (for example 1 mL)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak8rc","text":"Add 1 µL of 10,000 µg/mL TTB  for every 100 µL of methanol added to the sample vial.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt3os","text":"    Example: 10 µL into 1000 µL or 5 µL into 500 µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fbvf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
